Topic.Title: Apple iPhone 5: 50 Million + Sales Possible

Message.Msg: . "Of those upgrade-eligible respondents, 45% plan to purchase an iPhone and the vast majority are waiting for the iPhone 5. The next biggest group, 31%, said that they were undecided on their next phone, and those planning to buy Google‘s (GOOG) Android devices rounded out the bottom at 22%. Power writes “Those percentages, if they held, could suggest 50 million+ iPhone 5 sales in the U.S. alone, well above current forecasts.” . Wow! "Could suggest 50 million+ iPhone 5 sales in the U.S. alone." "Well above current forecasts.” Says Robert W. Baird analyst William Power. And then there's the rest of the world that wants a Genuine iPhone 5 too. So that's what? Maybe another 100 million+ international units. Clearly, the Genuine Apple iPhone 5 will be the Fastest Selling Electronic Device in the History of Mankind -- and nvidia parts had nothing to do with it. Are we sure that nvidia is actually IN the cellphone part business? Or just a little parts hobbyist? . .

Topic.Title: What do you think will happen to NVDA stock price if

Message.Msg: First of all Nvidia PE is much less than Yahoo shows. Did you notice that they use GAAP numbers in PE calculation whereas wall street uses NON-GAAP? Last quarter Nvidia made $0.27 but they show $0.19. As far as forward view is concerned I am even more optimistic than baseball. I think Nvidia will make at least $0.35 this quarter. That is $1.40 annual run rate. With 13%-15% sequential QoQ growth for last 2 Qs the company deserves at least PE=20. That is $28 right there. Plus $5.3 per share cash makes it $33. In reality if Nvidia will show 30% YoY growth for 2 years (this year is already almost in the book) it will be easily tolerated with PE=50. Just execute and don't worry about stock price. The reason I asked about upcoming Kindle announcement is that this close to a product release it is very difficult to keep secret about component suppliers. So many people already have this product in their hands, So I am sure all big boys already know what is inside. The actual announcement should not be a surprise to them. So if Nvidia is not there (and I am sure it is not) I expect a small initial retail sell off. I have my cash ready to use this opportunity and buy around $13.50.

Topic.Title: Apple,Samsung patent battle to delay iPhone 5 launch? (another reason)

Message.Msg: While I have no doubt Samsung will sue upon release of the iPhone5, there is zero chance that the threat of a lawsuit would EVER derail a release date. I'm sure Apple is threatened with suits with every major launch, as is any successful company. It is far more likely that supply issues are a problem for the iPhone5 (as you pointed out in another post) and Apple needs a convenient scapegoat.

Message.Title: HTC plays hard to get.
Message.Msg: . . "HTC chairwoman Cher Wang has confirmed that her company has no plans to settle its ongoing patent lawsuit with Apple, despite Cupertino's recent legal triumph over Samsung. In May, a Delaware court ordered the two companies to begin settlement talks, but Wang says HTC has no intention to settle, and remains undeterred by Samsung's recent setback. "Samsung’s defeat does not mean that Google Inc.’s Android camp is defeated," Wang told Cynes yesterday, adding that "every company has good innovations." Wang's comments, issued ahead of an APEC Business Advisory Council meeting, suggest that HTC is willing to take the matter to court, despite the fact that such recourse now seems rather RISKY, given last week's verdict. Late last year, the US International Trade Commission banned HTC phones from entering the US. HTC responded with a custom-built workaround, though it now appears that the dispute is far from over." Google this: "Cher Wang: HTC has no plans to settle patent lawsuit with Apple" . Stubborn, fiesty defendants make for the best show, right boys? Let's hope they get that same, even fiestyier lady Judge again. ...Miaow! ....Riieeewn! ....Miaw! ....Hisssss! ....RrreoowwWOW !!! . .

Topic.Title: what if RMBS had the Apple legal team??

Message.Msg: A defendant in a lawsuit involving large sums of money was talking to his lawyer. "If I lose this case, I'll be ruined." "It's in the judge's hands now," said the lawyer. "Would it help if I sent the judge a box of cigars?" "Oh no! This judge is a stickler or ethical behavior. A stunt like that would prejudice him against you. He might even hold you in contempt of court. In fact, you shouldn't even smile at the judge." Within the course of time, the judge rendered a decision in favor of the defendant. As the defendant left the courthouse, he said to his lawyer, "Thanks for the tip about the cigars. It worked!" "I'm sure we would have lost the case if you'd sent them." "But, I did send them." "You did WHAT?" said the lawyer, incredulously. "Yes. That's how we won the case." "I don't understand," said the lawyer. "I sent the cigars to the judge, but enclosed the plaintiff's business card."

Message.Title: Intel needs to adjust ATOM roadmap for PC use
Message.Msg: Digitimes says, Intel may be forced to adjust its roadmap for PC-use Atom processors as the top-2 netbook vendors – Asustek Computer and Acer – both plan to stop manufacturing related products, according to sources from notebook players. Asustek is already set to halt its Eee PC product line and officially phase out from the IT industry after completely digesting any remaining inventory. As for Acer, so far, the company has not yet made any plans to open new netbook projects, indicating that the vendor may also plan to step out of the market. Although Atom series processors will still be adopted by handset and embedded products, the sources believe the two product lines are unlikely to be able to fill the gap created by the absent netbook products in short term due to weak shipments. .... (Sales from Intel's new mobile offerings, if any, will not be enough to bridge the gap)
